DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Pamidronate disodium works by slowing the breakdown of bone, increasing bone density, and decreasing the amount of calcium released from the bones into the blood. It is a type of drug called a bisphosphonate.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Pamidronate disodium is approved to be given with chemotherapy to treat bone damage caused by:

ItemizedList.ListItem: breast cancer that has spread to bone
multiple myeloma that has spread to bone

Section.Para: Pamidronate disodium is also approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: hypercalcemia (high blood levels of calcium) caused by malignant cancer

Section.Para: Pamidronate disodium is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
